org.xbib.elasticsearch.index.analysis.combo

Class ComboAnalyzer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer
      • org.xbib.elasticsearch.index.analysis.combo.ComboAnalyzer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public class ComboAnalyzer
extends org.apache.lucene.analysis.Analyzer
    An analyzer that combines multiple sub-analyzers into one.

    It internally uses ReaderCloneFactory in order to feed the multiple sub-analyzers from a single input. If you analyzer big inputs or have a performance critical application, please see the remarks of the latter's documentation.

    The instances are thread safe with regards to the reused TokenStreams. As duplicated sub-analyzer instance would break this safety, there is a special case detection for it. However, there can still be cases where an Analyzer is used from multiple places at a time before the ComboTokenStream is fully consumed, and this causes problem. For a solution, see setTokenStreamCachingEnabled(boolean) and setTokenStreamCachingEnabled(boolean).

    • Method Detail

      • setTokenStreamCachingEnabled

        public ComboAnalyzer setTokenStreamCachingEnabled(boolean value)
        Enable or disable the systematic caching of Analyzer TokenStreams.

        TokenStreams gotten from the Analyzers will be cached upfront. This helps with one of the Analyzers being reused before having completely consumed our ComboTokenStream. Note that this can happen too, if the same Analyzer instance is given twice.

        Parameters:
        value - true to enable the caching of TokenStreams, false to disable it.
        Returns:
        This instance, for chainable construction.
        See Also:
        TOKENSTREAM_CACHING_ENABLED_DEFAULT
